item.title: How I built my website
item.description: Having never build a website from scratch, this has been a truly challenging yet rewarding experience from me. I told myself not to go the WordPress or Squarespace paid theme route to push my front-end web development skills, and woah, it’s definitely paid off. What I built this site on: Hugo Building upon Initio’s theme HTML5 Bootstrap CSS3 Jquery Markdown Open Sans typeface Netlify Hugo is an extremely fast static site generator.

item.title: Portfolio
item.description: When I first came to San Francisco, I was itching to work on viable business ideas and build (or break) things. A self-taught web developer, a Computer Science student and Swift developer, as well as myself got together to work on something that one of my team mates have been working on for a few months. It’s a simple problem: finding the right co-founders is often akin to finding needles in a haystack.

item.title: Portfolio
item.description: Attended my third hackathon in a row that month with low spirits and high caffeine levels, but lo-and-behold, my team and I managed to clinch the top 5 teams out of over 300 at the API World Hackathon 2016 in San Francisco. Kingfashion is a white-label, augmented reality mobile app that gamifies the shopping experience for online consumers. This idea came about when we realized how mundane and impersonal the current online shopping experience is.

item.title: Portfolio
item.description: What started off as a school project that I did with a few of my developer friends while we were on our internships in San Francsico turned out to be something that got us $10,000 in funding. After four failed attempts in getting our business ideas up and running, we were trying very hard to find an idea that would be beneficial to many and yet is able to spin the money-maker.

item.title: Portfolio
item.description: Being involved as the President of the NUS Entrepreneurship Society in 2016, I was very much engaged within the start-up scene in Singapore, and still is. The highlights of the year included: Inaugural Internship Fair We successfully liaised with over 20 corporate partners such as Uber, e27 and many other start-ups to hold the inaugural internship fair. The event saw over 300 budding entrepreneurs and start-up enthusiasts from all over Singapore (top three universities: NUS, NTU and SMU) who came down to NUS campus to seek internship opportunities from exciting start-ups.

item.title: Portfolio
item.description: I spent a year at Stellar Loyalty, an enterprise marketing SaaS start-up that provides brands with modern, cloud software that can engage and build loyalty with their customers. I do a range of things from back-end feature development to product designs of mobile and web applications. But, let’s talk about mobile for now. After hearing a range of feedback from clients and sales team alike, this project started out as a personal learning side-gig.

item.title: Portfolio
item.description: I recently started a 6-months internship in the growth marketing team, specifically managing social advertising spend for Uber’s APACx operations. As I am writing this in February 2017, it is still early days to share a specific project but all I can say is that my learning curve has been tremendous. Being someone who is growth hacking enthusiast (shout out to Josh Fetcher - check out his latest growth hack bible), I love the ability to strategize and execute on these hacks on such a large scale at Uber.
